channel.title: Ode To Love
channel.description:
This was a poem that I wrote in fifth grade, I just found it, and I kinda like it. Read and comment please. (It may not be the best, since this is from almost 5 years ago.)
[center][u]Ode To Love[/u] You can be welcoming and pure, But you can be harmful and corrupt. You can be simple and plain, But you can be baffling and convoluted. You can be flawless and impeccable, But you can be defective and delusional. You can show me the path, But you can be misleading. You can bring me happiness, But you aid my downfall. You can be honest and virtuous, But you can be deceptive and fraudulent. You can complete my life, But you can destroy it too. How can you be infallible, But so errant at the same time? Your presence is so strong, I cannot ignore it. I applaud you for having this ability, The ability to inflict damage, But also the ability to repair wounds. I cannot live without you, Although at times I feel as if I would be better off without you. I am not sure what to think; Are you a vital part of my life? Do I need you?[/center]

item.title: Ode To Love
item.dc:creator: @Syfal Syfal
item.description:
@Syfal wrote:

I liked it. Very good, especially for 5th grade

Read full topic

item.title: Ode To Love
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:10, topic:283334”][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=374418.msg3003146#msg3003146 date=1256166125]
I agree with cows, considering you don’t use many intellectual post at all.
[/quote]Anyone can make idiotic posts on a forum, it doesn’t mean they’re an idiot.

But, I think what they’re getting at is that it’s hard to believe that most of these words were part of your lexicon in 5th grade. Convoluted, impeccable, and fraudulent are just a few words that I can point out that I know a majority of 5th graders don’t know. You used a thesaurus? It’s common in all writers, even to those who are aware of such words with that high of value.[/quote]
I used a thesaurus for ‘convoluted’. That’s about it. All the other words are ones 5th graders should know…

Read full topic

But, I think what they’re getting at is that it’s hard to believe that most of these words were part of your lexicon in 5th grade. Convoluted, impeccable, and fraudulent are just a few words that I can point out that I know a majority of 5th graders don’t know. You used a thesaurus? item.title: Ode To Love
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:7, topic:283334”][quote author=dragonfire455 link=topic=374418.msg2998789#msg2998789 date=1255806812]

I don’t really like the poem, and to me it just seems that you didn’t write it. Especially the use of that grammar during 5th grade.

Not every 5th grader has bad grammar… In fact, you must be dumb if you don’t know the correct usage of grammar in 5th grade.

Who said I didn’t know correct use of grammar at grade 5? I simply do not believe that you would have known so many intellectual words at age 10.
[/quote]Actually, my reading level at the filth grade grade was at a ninth grade level, now it’s college level. Mainly, because back then I read books all the time and had them done within a couple of hours.

Did you know that if your reading level was at 9th grade in the fifth, it did not mean that you would know all the words or grammar that a 9th grader would?

iirc I took a test at 6th grade saying I was meant to be doing senior reading, it was all just lies. Simply the assignments that I had to do and read were in the 6th grade, and this meant they were easy.[/quote]
Lol, you think the whole world is as dumb and ignorant as you? Just because you don’t have that intellectual ability in 5th grade, doesn’t mean that others don’t.

Read full topic

Did you know that if your reading level was at 9th grade in the fifth, it did not mean that you would know all the words or grammar that a 9th grader would?

iirc I took a test at 6th grade saying I was meant to be doing senior reading, it was all just lies. Simply the assignments that I had to do and read were in the 6th grade, and this meant they were easy.

item.title: Ode To Love
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

This was a poem that I wrote in fifth grade, I just found it, and I kinda like it. Read and comment please. (It may not be the best, since this is from almost 5 years ago.)

[center]Ode To Love
You can be welcoming and pure,
But you can be harmful and corrupt.
You can be simple and plain,
But you can be baffling and convoluted.
You can be flawless and impeccable,
But you can be defective and delusional.
You can show me the path,
But you can be misleading.
You can bring me happiness,
But you aid my downfall.
You can be honest and virtuous,
But you can be deceptive and fraudulent.
You can complete my life,
But you can destroy it too.
How can you be infallible,
But so errant at the same time?
Your presence is so strong,
I cannot ignore it.
I applaud you for having this ability,
The ability to inflict damage,
But also the ability to repair wounds.
I cannot live without you,
Although at times I feel as if I would be better off without you.
I am not sure what to think;
Are you a vital part of my life? Do I need you?[/center]

Read full topic
